title: `fs::read_dir` is not fused for network locations on Windows

labels.name: A-io
labels.description: Area: std::io, std::fs, std::net and std::path

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
fn main() {
    let mut read_dir = std::fs::read_dir(r#"\\live.sysinternals.com\tools"#).unwrap();
    let _ = read_dir.by_ref().collect::<Vec<_>>();
    assert!(read_dir.next().is_none());
}
```

I expected to see this happen: assert does not fail

Instead, this happened:
```
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: read_dir.next().is_none()', src\main.rs:4:5
```

After each returned `None` the iterator will start iterating from the beginning. Even though `ReadDir` does not implement `FusedIterator`, I think it would be more predictable if it was fused. The current behavior led to a bug in Tokio and was originally discovered in tokio-rs/tokio#5473.
